), and to decrease the weight of correctly classified examples. In such

calculated as a weighted majority of the T weak classifiers where
In the following, we detail each step in our present work:
inputs are patches fromthe images and y
outputs are an element of a set comprising of only two values, 1 (The grain boundary) and
2. Initialize all weights of the samples to 1 divided by the number of patches (
classifier, fit it to the training data (where each prediction is either -1 or 1)
and select the classifier with the lowest weighted classification error.
In the context of object tracking, the classifier is trained during runtime (shown in
The trained classifier predicts the position of the target in the next frame till the end of video.
The relevant package is already available in the open-cv python package [
tracker requires the user to define a subset of the image on the first frame that
will then be tracked. An example is shown in
as a red dashed rectangle. This region
should contain the region of interest (ROI). Our ROI here is the grain boundary, which
appears as a low density linear region on the detector hit maps. Sometimes a part of the grain
boundary is not tracked due to the limited size of tracking window. Whilst the size of the track-
ing window is fixed whilst the size of image of the GB on the detector can change. Therefore if
the image of the GB grows too large, the tracking window might not be able to cover it. Even if
some parts of the GB have not been identified by
, it can be partly solved by the fitting
of the GB plane in the following steps of the algorithm. In addition, data extracted fromtrack-
ing this complete window would not just contain the GB but also the surrounding matrix.
Hence, additional filtering steps in BooT-PCA are required so as to only select the feature of
Here we aimto track a nearly linear feature, which are known to be efficiently detected by
the Hough transform. The Hough transformis widely used in image analysis and computer
]. It is commonly used for indexing Kikuchi patterns collected using electron back-
]. It has also been used previously in three-dimensions to
reveal the presence of atomic planes within the atomprobe reconstruction [
work, the Hough transformimplementation is based on Python open-cv package [
shows that linear features can be detected using the Hough transformalgorithmwithin the
tracking window, and hence used to refine the feature selection inside the ROI.
we collect all points along the detected linear features (red-dotted
lines) using Hough transform, then direct 3Dreconstruction is performed. However, here, not
every linear feature detected in the ROI is necessarily a section of the grain boundary trace.
The strong patterning associated to the field evaporation of pure-Al results in several zone
3Dnanostructural characterisation of grain boundaries in atomprobe data
